alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 18 at 8:45AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, San Luis Obispo. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor roadway and small stream flooding is expected, especially in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 838 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated bands of moderate to heavy rain moving into coastal and foothill areas of northern San Luis Obispo county, mainly Morro Bay northward.This on top of the moderate to heavy rainfall that fell in the past 6 hours will likely result in some urban and small stream flooding. Rainfall rates between 0.33 and 0.75 inches per hour will be common across the advisory area, with local rates approaching 1.00 inch per hour, mainly in the foothills and near thunderstorms. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Paso Robles, Morro Bay, Atascadero, Cambria, Point Piedras Blancas, Cayucos, Lake Nacimiento, Templeton, Baywood-Los Osos, Hearst Castle, Santa Margarita and Highway 101 over Cuesta Grade. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
